alert.note: Alert for Muscatine (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 20 at 1:16PM CDT until further notice by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Iowa... Illinois... Mississippi River at Camanche affecting Scott, Whiteside, Clinton and Rock Island Counties. Mississippi River at New Boston LD17 affecting Mercer and Louisa Counties. Mississippi River at Bellevue LD12 affecting Jo Daviess, Clinton, Jackson and Carroll Counties. Mississippi River at Le Claire LD14 affecting Scott and Rock Island Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Iowa... Illinois... Mississippi River at Keithsburg affecting Des Moines, Mercer, Henderson and Louisa Counties. Mississippi River at Rock Island LD15 affecting Muscatine, Scott and Rock Island Counties. Mississippi River at Dubuque LD11 affecting Dubuque and Jo Daviess Counties. Mississippi River at Dubuque affecting Dubuque, Jo Daviess and Jackson Counties. Mississippi River at Muscatine affecting Muscatine, Mercer, Rock Island and Louisa Counties. Mississippi River at Ill. City LD16 affecting Muscatine and Rock Island Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE FRIDAY NIGHT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississippi River at Ill. City LD16. * WHEN...From late Friday night until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 18.5 feet, Water floods Andalusias Second Street in the unprotected area. Water is also at the foundations of several homes in Midway Beach. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:30 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 14.2 feet and rising. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Saturday morning and continue rising to 18.7 feet Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 18.5 feet on 07/02/2013. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/quadcities. The next statement will be issued late tonight.
